column8:
Composer, saxophonist and pianist, Archie Shepp has been a major influence in Jazz music since the 1960's. By the the 70's he had begun a career as a professor of music and in 2004 founded his own record label - Archieball.
His Afrocentric music has been a hallmark of his career and something he has used to highlight the issues of African-Americans.
column21: A unique t-shirt celebrating Archie Shepp, from weadmire.net
